abstract: Publicis Groupe, the French advertising giant, struck a deal to buy Razorfish, the interactive agency that Microsoft has owned since acquiring the agency’s parent company, aQuantive, in 2007.
snippet: Publicis Groupe, the French advertising giant, struck a deal to buy Razorfish, the interactive agency that Microsoft has owned since acquiring the agency’s parent company, aQuantive, in 2007.
lead_paragraph: The French advertising giant Publicis Groupe struck a deal Sunday to buy Razorfish, the interactive agency that Microsoft has owned since acquiring the agency’s parent company, aQuantive, in 2007, The New York Times’s Stuart Elliott reported.

headline.main: Microsoft Strikes Razorfish Deal With Publicis

abstract: Should Microsoft and Yahoo have to give more details about their search deal? The Deal Professor looks at this and some other disclosure-related questions that have recently arisen.
snippet: Should Microsoft and Yahoo have to give more details about their search deal? The Deal Professor looks at this and some other disclosure-related questions that have recently arisen.
lead_paragraph: Update | 1:45 p.m.  I was on semivacation last week, so I missed what was clearly an uptick in deal action. As usual, here is some commentary on the more striking goings-on.

headline.main: Catching Up: More on Disclosure (or Lack Thereof)

abstract: Doug Cutting, one of Yahoo’s top search experts, leaves for a start-up. His departure comes just weeks after Yahoo agreed to turn its search operations over to Microsoft.
snippet: Doug Cutting, one of Yahoo’s top search experts, leaves for a start-up. His departure comes just weeks after Yahoo agreed to turn its search operations over to Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Doug Cutting, one of Yahoo’s top search and infrastructure software experts, will leave the company later this month and join the Silicon Valley start-up Cloudera.

headline.main: An Elephant Leaves the Room at Yahoo
